entries.name: 刘华平
entries.bio: 刘华平，清华大学计算机科学与技术系教授，国家杰出青年科学基金获得者，中国人工智能学会理事，中国自动化学会智能自动化专业委员会主任委员。担任Robotics Sciences and Systems(RSS)的领域主席，International Journal of Robotics Research的Senior Editor。主要研究方向为智能机器人的多模态感知、学习与控制技术。
entries.title: 具身协同导航与交互学习
entries.abstract: 当前，复杂高动态环境对机器人的感知与学习提出了更加迫切的需求。集群系统为多机器人协同应用带来了效能倍增与应用突破，同时也对群体智能的感知、学习的理论研究与工程应用带来了巨大的挑战。本报告面向态势理解在适应异构机器人平台感知、动作的能力差异，以及适应广域动态场景高效、鲁棒的感知这两大类多机器人协同任务需求，针对如何利用异构多机器人的感知与学习能力实现集群增效与行为涌现，介绍相关的研究进展。

entries.name: Guillaume Gomez
entries.bio: Rust language reviewer and contributor, rustdoc team leader.
entries.title: Writing your own Rust linter
entries.abstract:
This talk will show you how to write your own rust linter using the rustc_tools crate which allows you to have access to the rust compiler API. It can be quite useful if you need specific lints for a project and cannot add them to clippy.

It will also explain how the compiler API works and give a small example at the end showing it in action.
entries.details: I will show how to create a linter and give an example on how to write a simple lint as a start. Give an overview of how the Rust compiler work internally and explain the interactions between the linter and the rust compiler.

entries.name: Nicholas Nethercote
entries.bio: Nicholas is a long-term contributor to the Rust compiler and author of the Rust Performance Book. He previously worked at Mozilla, where he led multiple technical efforts to improve Firefox's performance and reliability and managed the Low-Level Tools team. He has also worked for Apple and National ICT Australia. He co-won a Most Influential PLDI Paper Award for the paper "Valgrind: a Framework for Heavyweight Dynamic Binary Instrumentation" which was based on work done during his PhD. He has particular interests in code performance, correctness, clarity, and has built several widely-used profiling tools. He currently works full-time on the Rust compiler for Futurewei Technologies.
entries.title: Rust Compiler Overview
entries.abstract: This talk will provide an overview of the Rust compiler: what it looks like, how it works, how its internals are structured, and how it is developed.
entries.details: This talk will provide an overview of the Rust compiler: what it looks like, how it works, how its internals are structured, and how it is developed.

entries.name: Josh Triplett
entries.bio:
Dr. Josh Triplett is a developer on the Rust project, working on the language, standard library, and Cargo package manager. Josh cares about building welcoming, inclusive communities that lift people up. Josh loves building solutions to systemic problems.

In his mythical "spare time", Josh works on fast build systems, using Rust.
entries.title: Fireside chat
entries.abstract: A cozy interview and Q&A with Dr. Josh Triplett, from the Rust Project language, library, and Cargo teams.
entries.details: A cozy interview and Q&A with Dr. Josh Triplett, from the Rust Project language, library, and Cargo teams, interviewed by Professor Chen from Tsinghua University. We'll discuss a variety of topics, and field questions from the audience as well.

entries.name: Gregory Terzian
entries.bio: I have contributed to Servo since 2016. I became a reviewer in 2019, and have been a founding member of the Technical Steering Committee since 2020. The script component, as well as the overall architecture of Servo, has been my priority over the years.
entries.title: Servo Web Engine - topic TBD
entries.abstract: A talk about a facet of the Servo Web Engine

entries.name: Zonghuan Wu
entries.bio: Dr. Wu holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the State University of New York and an MBA. He is the co-founder of CantorAI and a former research engineer, architect, and leader of multinational R&D teams at Huawei's U.S. Research Institute and Turkey Research Institute. Dr. Wu provides consulting services on technological development, innovation, and productization in AI, knowledge graphs, and search for various enterprises and universities. He also shares cutting-edge insights on AI through the "RelevantNews" public WeChat account.
entries.title: Toward AIOS: Super Agents & Composition AI
entries.abstract: The AI era has risen with the emergence of large language models and will undoubtedly flourish with the maturation of AIOS. All of our efforts are aimed at this goal, focusing on advancing an open, local, and composable AI ecosystem. This talk will highlight the MoFA open-source project, a modular, composable, and programmable AI agent framework. Through an overview of our project suite, we will outline the blueprint for realizing a composable AIOS.
entries.details:
Sketch:
- Composition AI and Agent Composition 
- Introduction of MoFA , a unique modular, compositional and programmable Agent Framework 
- MoFA Demonstration  
- The blueprint of AIOS
